articles.author: Alex Lawler, Olesya Astakhova, Maha Dahan
articles.description: The OPEC+ alliance of oil producers will consider additional production cuts for next year to support crude prices in virtual meetings on Thursday, three delegates told Reuters.
articles.title: OPEC+ ministers meet to discuss additional oil output cuts

articles.author: Chavi Mehta
articles.description: More advertisers are likely to flee Elon Musk's social media platform X after the billionaire lashed out at some of the biggest names in the media industry at a New York Times DealBook event for dropping out of the platform, analysts said on Thursday.
articles.title: Analysts predict more brands will flee X after Musk tirade

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: A U.S. judge late on Thursday blocked Montana's first-of-its kind state ban on the use of short-video sharing app TikTok from taking effect on Jan. 1, saying it violated the free speech rights of users.
articles.title: US judge blocks Montana from banning TikTok use in state

articles.author: Svea Herbst-Bayliss, Dawn Chmielewski, Samrhitha A
articles.description: Activist investor Nelson Peltz is pushing ahead with plans to seek at least three board seats at Disney (DIS.N) as the firm is not satisfied with Disney CEO Bob Iger's changes, several people familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: Nelson Peltz's Trian to seek at least three Disney board seats, sources say

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: A bipartisan group of 11 U.S. House lawmakers on Thursday asked the Biden administration to investigate and potentially sanction Chinese drone maker Autel Robotics, citing national security concerns.
articles.title: US lawmakers seek probe of Chinese drone maker Autel Robotics

articles.author: Martin Coulter
articles.description: Google (GOOGL.O) has called on Britain’s antitrust regulator to take action against Microsoft (MSFT.O), claiming its business practices had left rivals at a significant disadvantage, according to a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Google pushes for antitrust action against Microsoft in UK cloud market

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) on Thursday said it is proposing to extend the cockpit voice-recording requirement to 25 hours for all new airplanes from the current two-hour loop.
articles.title: US FAA wants new planes to capture more cockpit data to boost safety probes

articles.author: Andrew Mills
articles.description: As world leaders feted Qatar for brokering a truce between Israel and Hamas last week, its negotiators doubled down on their mediation efforts, fearful the ceasefire was about to collapse before it started.
articles.title: Insight: How Qatar swayed Israel and Hamas to make a truce work

articles.author: Leika Kihara
articles.description: Asia's factory activity remained weak in November on soft global demand, surveys showed on Friday, with mixed signs on the strength of China's economy clouding the outlook for the region's fragile recovery.
articles.title: Asia factory activity weakens, uncertainty on China clouds outlook

articles.author: Stella Qiu
articles.description: Asian sharemarkets started the last month of the year on a cautious note after recent strong gains, though growing expectations Europe and the U.S. are poised to cut rates should help ease pressure on local currencies and central banks.
articles.title: Asia shares start Dec on cautious note, oil nurses losses
